sentences.sentence: A cry for justice in Memphis, Tennessee.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Released video footage of black police officers brutally beating a young black motorist, Tyre Nichols, in early January has reignited calls for police reform.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Nichols died in hospital three days later. That George Floyd bill, had it been law, might have made some of these police think twice.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This U.S. Senate and this Congress needs to deal with these civil rights issues of these times, and that is the George Floyd bill and the policing act and we're gonna come out of Memphis and fight like we never fought before to pass federal policing law five officers from the Nichols footage have been charged with second-degree murder and aggravated assault among other charges Memphis Police Department has disbanded the special unit which contained the officers accused.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Petr Prevel will be the Czech Republic's new president,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: after confidently defeating his opponent, former Prime Minister Andrei Babis, in a run-off vote which ended Saturday afternoon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: On stage, the 61-year-old retired general thanked the people who cast ballots in this election and said that truth and humility won.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The new president will take his oath on March 9th after his predecessor Milo Zeman held office for 10 years and was considered by many to be a Euroskeptic politician. take his oath on March 9th after his predecessor Miloš Zeman held office for 10 years and was considered by many to be a Euro-skeptic politician.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: With the election of Petr Pavel, the Czech Republic will once again have a clearly pro-Western president.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The former general supports the introduction of the Euro, military aid to Ukraine and, as he said during the campaign, he's not opposed to the legalization of same-sex marriage.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Adam Magyar, Euronews, Prague, Czech Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Casting their votes on Sunday, Tunisians are taking part in a second round of parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: The votes being seen as a key test of President Kai Saïd's push to consolidate power, tame Islamist rivals and win back lenders and investors to bolster the economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Turnout will also be a significant measure of the legitimacy of the process. Just 11% of Tunisians voted in the first round last month.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Results are expected in the next few days.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: This was former U.S. President Donald Trump's message to his supporters as he attempted to kick off his election campaign on Saturday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: A few hundred supporters turned out to see the Republican in South Carolina, but some have slammed the politician for failing to make any public appearances since he announced he was running for office last November.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The 76-year-old still faces legal and political headwinds after he attempted to overturn his 2020 election defeat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Serbia's Novak Djokovic won his 10th Australian Open title in Melbourne on Sunday for what he has dubbed the biggest victory in my life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: title in Melbourne on Sunday for what he has dubbed the biggest victory in my life.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The 35-year-old beat Stefanos Tsitsipas of Greece in straight sets 6-3, 7-6, 7-6.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The win puts him neck to neck with his rival Rafael Nadal for the most Grand Slam wins by man in tennis history. The victory comes a year after he was deported from Australia for entering the country without being vaccinated against COVID-19.
